answers.answer: Go swimming, elevate your feet (especially lying on the floor with feet up the wall), and drink LOTS of water.

I had it bad first pregnancy too and developed preeclampsia. It's been so hot here as its summer and have been getting swollen feet lots! I'm 24+3 at the moment. Drink water, keep your feet up when you can during the day, have some time at night to put your feet higher up, I use a hot water bottle by my feet at night that has been in the freezer all day it's amazing! Look into some Yoga stretching for your feet/ankles too that helps!

Thanks! I just want to avoid it getting as bad as it did when I was pregnant 6 years ago! I knew cutting back on sodium could help but otherwise feel helpless! I'll definitely take time throughout the day to put my feet up and load up on the water too!

question: I'm 21w5d and have really started experiencing swollen feet, especially by the end of the day. They ache pretty badly too! With my first, I had severe Edema and it looks like the early arrival of swollen feet now is a sign I will have it again. Anyone else already having this? Anyone have advice as to what helped you keep the swelling down?
title: Swollen Feet
